notations.name: Type Judgment
notations.description: A formal statement asserting that a term has a certain type in a given context
notations.searchText: type judgment a formal statement asserting that a term has a certain type in a given context type theory plt typing relation type assignment $gamma tack e : tau$ gamma tack e : tau \gamma \vdash e : \tau

notations.name: Lambda Abstraction
notations.description: A function definition in lambda calculus
notations.searchText: lambda abstraction a function definition in lambda calculus lambda calculus plt function literal anonymous function $lambda x. e$ lambda x. e \lambda x. e

notations.name: Set Union
notations.description: The union of two sets A and B is the set of elements which are in A, in B, or in both
notations.searchText: set union the union of two sets a and b is the set of elements which are in a, in b, or in both set theory operations union join $a union b$ a union b a \cup b a ∪ b

notations.name: Set Intersection
notations.description: The intersection of two sets A and B is the set of elements which are in both A and B
notations.searchText: set intersection the intersection of two sets a and b is the set of elements which are in both a and b set theory operations intersection meet $a sect b$ a sect b a \cap b a ∩ b

notations.name: Element Membership
notations.description: A relation between an element and a set, indicating that the element belongs to the set
notations.searchText: element membership a relation between an element and a set, indicating that the element belongs to the set set theory relations belongs to is in membership $x in a$ x in a x \in a x ∈ a

notations.name: Summation
notations.description: The sum of a sequence of numbers
notations.searchText: summation the sum of a sequence of numbers arithmetic analysis sum sigma notation $sum_(i=1)^n a_i$ sum_(i=1)^n a_i \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i ∑ᵢ₌₁ⁿ aᵢ

notations.name: Universal Quantification
notations.description: A logical statement asserting that a property holds for all elements in a domain
notations.searchText: universal quantification a logical statement asserting that a property holds for all elements in a domain logic quantifiers for all universal quantifier $forall x. p(x)$ forall x. p(x) \forall x. p(x) ∀x. p(x)

notations.name: Existential Quantification
notations.description: A logical statement asserting that there exists at least one element satisfying a property
notations.searchText: existential quantification a logical statement asserting that there exists at least one element satisfying a property logic quantifiers there exists existential quantifier $exists x. p(x)$ exists x. p(x) \exists x. p(x) ∃x. p(x)
